assessments.assessment_title: Consecutive Interpreting of Short Speech Segments
assessments.task_description:
Students will interpret very short speech segments from English into LOTE (Chinese/Japanese) and from LOTE (Chinese/Japanese) into English in the consecutive mode. Four short speech segments (2 in English and 2 in LOTE) are taken out of formal speeches in the speech categories covered in class during the first few weeks of the semester. The short speech segments may be the beginnings, endings or set expressions in formal speeches. Students will be given the speech topics and interpreting brief one week in advance. On the day of the exam, there won't be any preparation time for each interpreting activity. One A4 sheet of handwritten or typed notes, double sided, is permitted. Students' interpreting performance in the exam will be assessed according to the marking rubric of this course.

Statement on Generative AI & MT

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assessment task is designed to be face-to-face in a designated lab. Students' interpreting performances are recorded by the lecturer using voice-recorders in the designated lab for this course. Students can use their own voice-recorders to record their interpreting performances as a backup in case there is a technical problem.

learning_activities.topic:
Public speaking lecture and consecutive interpreting practice

One-hour lecture on public speaking and associated knowledge in week 1. Half an hour of shadowing of formal speeches in English and LOTE in week 1. One-and-a-half-hour practice of consecutive interpreting of short speech segments in week 1. Three-hour practice of consecutive interpreting of short speech segments in week 2.


Learning outcomes: L01

learning_activities.topic:
Dialogue interpreting practice (Chinese stream and Japanese stream are combined)

There will be a lecture on dialogue interpreting in week 3. Students will then be divided into three-person groups to engage in role-plays in community settings, in which one person will act as an English-speaking professional, another person will act as a LOTE (Chinese/Japanese)-speaking client, and the other person will work as an interpreter facilitating the communication between those two primary interlocutors. Scripts containing English and LOTE will be provided to the students who act as the primary interlocutors. Students will then participate in discussions regarding the quality of interpreting performance and interpreters' interactional management.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03

learning_activities.topic:
Dialogue interpreting practice (language-specific tutorials)

Weekly 3-hour language specific tutorial for dialogue interpreting practice, with teacher feedback on the quality of interpreting performance. Students will listen to dialogues in the form of voice-recordings and practice dialogue interpreting. Students may take brief notes during the listening comprehension phase to aid the dialogue interpreting.
